column3: @Transactional的bean无法被追踪
column4: 目前bean的增强在TracingEnhanceProcessor.postProcessAfterInitialization中。 @Transactional的Bean由于会被Spring的JDKDynamicAOP给代理了，所以传入到TracingEnhanceProcessor类中就只能获取到Proxy对象(如：实际传入名称为com.sun.proxy.$Proxy17)，并非Bean的实际对象，所以导致无法追踪。 但是如果将增强Bean的功能放到postProcessBeforeInitialization方法，会造成类名被修改，可能会造成Dubbo无法合理的识别类名并发布服务。

column3: New Context Carrier CODING STYLE
column4: This pr is not for performance or new feature, it is just about coding style.  I did these adjustments for increasing the expandability of skywalking propagation mechanism.   - Client side. Put key:value pairs into **HTTP HEAD** by iterating Carrier items. ```java             span = ContextManager.createExitSpan("/span/operation/name", contextCarrier, "ip:port");             CarrierItem next = contextCarrier.items();             while (next.hasNext()) {                 next = next.next();                 heads.put(next.getHeadKey(), next.getHeadValue());             } ```  - Server side Set value from the **HTTP HEAD** of the given keys of carrier items. ```java             ContextCarrier contextCarrier = new ContextCarrier();             CarrierItem next = contextCarrier.items();             while (next.hasNext()) {                 next = next.next();                 next.setHeadValue(heads.get(next.getHeadKey()));             }              span = ContextManager.createEntrySpan(“/span/operation/name”, contextCarrier); ```

column3: [Big Change] Update the trace-structure

column3: [Agent] ServiceComb Plugin
column4: ServiceComb Java Chassis is a Software Development Kit (SDK) for rapid development of microservices in Java, providing service registration, service discovery, dynamic routing, and service management features. It is provided by Huawei OpenSource Group.  I think we should support them on tracing, although they provide official zipkin integration, but clearly we can provide more features in tracing and APM.  This is feedback of ServiceComb team, about how to instrument the SDK. @ascrutae You can check the discussion on [Google mailist](https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/servicecomb-developers/fL612WnlTWI) >I think all three may be achieve by instrumenting io.servicecomb.core.Invocation#next. A provider will assemble any request into an invocation and a consumer will pass request as invocation. Invocation itself contains request headers and the next method of invocation has a response as its parameter. The current zipkin integration also makes use of invocation to pass along trace and span ids.

column3: The elastic modules for aggregation contain id only
column4: Right now, for avoiding uncompressed serviceName(OperationName) and peer(IP:port), we build the elastice aggregation modules, which contain both String(name) and id. This is not good for query.  So, we should set a buffer(memory and file) for this type of serviceName and peer, wait for exchange(compression) .  This will make the elastic modules and query easier for everyone.

column3: Optimize TracerContext.activeSpanStack
column4: Right now, `TracerContext.activeSpanStack` is a `ArrayList`, which has a certain size. Resize it or too many will cause too many memory and gc resource.  So I will set it as a `linkedList`.

column3: Support retry when IF_POSSIBLE strategy in DataCarrier
column4: Right now, **IF_POSSIBLE**  strategy only try once in selected buffer. When using `SimpleRollingPartitioner`, it is possible to save segments into the same buffer in high concurrency. So, adding retry time ( default is 3 ), will increase the chances to avoid discarding segments.  cc @ascrutae @pengys5

column3: Provide Topological graphs by every given application
column4: Right now ,the topological graph is based on the whole application cluster, including all applications. But in service mesh, like Linkerd, it is a proxy for every application. So the topological graph is losing its effects, which show the relationship and dependency.  So, we provide a new type of topological graph: When you choose a certain application, we put it as the entry application, and show the applications which it depends.  cc @hanahmily @pengys5 @ascrutae

column3: springMvc项目启动不执行Controller的RequestMapping映射
column4: Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.  ### What version of sky-walking are you using? 3.2.3-2017  ### What version of your OS? win10  ### What version of your JRE? JDK1.8.0_31  ### What company or project? spring-webmvc-3.2.16  ### What did you do? If possible, provide a way for reproducing the error. e.g. demo application, component version. **背景**：系统中对Controller做了切面，Controller没有实现接口。 + 当我直接启动时（未加入skywalking-agent的虚拟机参数），发现spring会生成Controller的Cglib代理对象，但是当我加入skywalking-agent的虚拟机参数启动时，spring会生成Controller的Jdk代理对象； + 进一步debug发现，spring之所以生成Controller的Jdk代理，是因为发现Controller有一个接口：org.skywalking.apm.agent.core.plugin.interceptor.enhance.EnhancedInstance；最终在spring的RequestMappingHandlerMapping类中就无法从代理类中获取到Controller类的标注了（Controller或RequestMapping），所以就不做url的映射了。

column3: Support to set operation name which returns from server side
column4: Many people use *URI-include-parameters* style URI, when this happen, compress mechanism in 3.2 will fail, even cost more memory than before. In order to resolve this, for HTTP, if our agent is at server side, it can return formatted-URI through HTTP response by instrument SpringMVC, like `/product/order/{orderId}`.  For doing this, we also need to support to set empty or null operation name when creating exit/entry span. This is a tricky solution provided by @pengys5 .  Further more, in some next version, we can use URI pattern recognition mechanism at collector side, and downstream the patterns for resolve this situations more complete.  cc @ascrutae

column3: Support transaction sampling
column4: If agent send all TraceSegment to collector-cluster, it costs so much network bandwidth.  We provide a config set the percentage of sampling. This minimum unit is 1/10000, which means send one TraceSegment to the collector every 10000 times.  When we face this scenario: A -> B, if TraceSegment is sampled in A, then the related TraceSegment in B must be sampled, no matter you sampling rate.  If we want to support this, we will add a new field(`sampling`) in TraceSegmentRef.  cc @ascrutae.  And @pengys5 , I think this do not influence the Collector? Confirm?

column3: Don't propagate all globalTraceIds
column4: If a single trace segment has more than one, it means existing batch process, e.g. mq. When this happened, we propagate all globalTraceIds， but this had potential performance issues.  So the agent change to only propagate the first one, like the entryServiceName/Id.  After we have this, the length of carrier will not increase, when batch process happened.  cc @pengys5 @ascrutae

column3: Fix NullPointerException when deserialize tags of span
column4: If `Span` does not have `tagsWithBool` , the serialization data does not contain `tagsWithBool` data, and the collector does not initialize the` tagsWithBool` field during deserialize, and it will cause NullPointerException when operation `tagsWithBool` field.

column3: Add Span amount control mechanism, also memory limit mechanism
column4: I want to make sure the amount of spans per segment is estimated, so in some meaning, the memory cost is estimated.  The default amount is 300, because unlikely a server segment trace have more spans than that, of course, you can override it through agent config mechanism.  @peng-yongsheng For collector side, I adjust the network protocol, add a new field `isSizeLimited`. If `true`, mean the control mechanism works, and not all spans uplink to collector. In this case, some parent span id in ref(from other backend application) is set to 0, because their parent span does not exist.  @ascrutae Since I adjust the core of agent, I think you need to run automatic test and integration test both. Feedback when you have done.  @peng-yongsheng @ascrutae Some days later, we should adjust trace stack UI to tell people the segment don't contain all spans because of control mechanism.  FYI @oracle219, I think you are interesting in this pr.

column3: Optimize the entry span’s operationName
column4: I prepare this for the url, which includes the parameters, like some Spring controllers always did, except for me :( . e.g. `/order/save/{orderId}`.  When I want to capture a tomcat service with that style url, the operationName actually is `/order/save/OHXXXXX123`. But this url changes in every saving order operation. As changing happens, the dictionary/encoding mechanism didn't work, even cost more memory.  So I ask for supporting Spring plugin. #282   But the agent core decided whether the  dictionary/encoding works or not, when creating `TracingContext#createEntrySpan`. So the actual url is still asked for encoding.   I use this pr to fix this.

column3: Design Defect: No feedback after RegisterRecoverService triggered
column4: Hi @peng-yongsheng and @ascrutae . This is a design defect first, not just a coding bug.  These are codes about calling RegisterRecoverService, line 114-129 ```java                           if (needRegisterRecover) {                                 instanceDiscoveryServiceBlockingStub.registerRecover(ApplicationInstanceRecover.newBuilder()                                     .setApplicationId(RemoteDownstreamConfig.Agent.APPLICATION_ID)                                     .setApplicationInstanceId(RemoteDownstreamConfig.Agent.APPLICATION_INSTANCE_ID)                                     .setRegisterTime(System.currentTimeMillis())                                     .setOsinfo(OSUtil.buildOSInfo())                                     .build());                             } ```  **needRegisterRecover** is not set to `true` when connect_status = CONNECTED and application_instance_id exists.  **But**, these is no chance to change **needRegisterRecover** to `false` again. Right now, we only have one choice, trust the collector, and set `false` after calling the service. Clearly, it is a good design.  For now, the RegisterRecoverService runs again and again, no chance to jump out.

column3: Collector deserialization bug
column4: For the collector performance, in 3.0.1, we use a simple deserialization mechanism. But in the real world, it triggers bugs several times.  We will give a hotfix patch by release 3.0.2, but the implementation is not best.  So, in 3.1, we will use a whole new segment-collect service, using `length1 segment-json1` `length2 segment-json2`...  Related #200 #203

column3: Support the plugin targeting interface and annotation
column4: For a long time, we support the target class of plugin must be an explicit class name, by returning full name of `AbstractClassEnhancePluginDefine.enhanceClassName()`.   It's easy enough but not powerful, as Spring annotation style became more and more popular, supporting to intercept classes with a certain annotation seems more and more important. And supporting annotation is similar with supporting interface implementation.  But, I have to change the return value of `AbstractClassEnhancePluginDefine.enhanceClassName()`. It is pained, since we have finished a big refactor, and I miss this.  cc @ascrutae @pengys5

            }          }                  ;     }       private Span createSpanFromParent(Span parentSpan, String operationName) {         if (parentSpan == null) {             return tracer.buildSpan(operationName).start();         } else {             return tracer.buildSpan(operationName).asChildOf(parentSpan).start();         }     }  } ```  server interceptor code ```java package cn.enncloud.ceres.core.interceptor;  import cn.enncloud.ceres.Constants; import io.grpc.*; import io.opentracing.Span; import io.opentracing.SpanContext; import io.opentracing.Tracer; import io.opentracing.contrib.OpenTracingContextKey; import io.opentracing.propagation.Format;         this.tracedAttributes = new HashSet();     }      public enum ServerRequestAttribute {         HEADERS,         METHOD_TYPE,         METHOD_NAME,         CALL_ATTRIBUTES     }       @Override     public  ServerCall.Listener interceptCall(ServerCall call, Metadata headers, ServerCallHandler next) {         Map headerMap = new HashMap();         for (String key : headers.keys()) {             if (!key.endsWith(Metadata.BINARY_HEADER_SUFFIX)) {                 String value = headers.get(Metadata.Key.of(key, Metadata.ASCII_STRING_MARSHALLER));                 headerMap.put(key, value);             }          }          final String operationName = call.getMethodDescriptor().getFullMethodName();         final Span span = getSpanFromHeaders(headerMap, operationName);         Tags.COMPONENT.set(span, Constants.CERES);         Tags.SPAN_KIND.set(span, Tags.SPAN_KIND_SERVER);         Tags.PEER_HOSTNAME.set(span, "127.0.0.1");         Tags.PEER_PORT.set(span, (short) 4321);         for (ServerRequestAttribute attr : this.tracedAttributes) {             switch (attr) {                 case METHOD_TYPE:                     span.setTag("grpc.method_type", call.getMethodDescriptor().getType().toString());                     break;                 case METHOD_NAME:                     span.setTag("grpc.method_name", call.getMethodDescriptor().getFullMethodName());                     break;                 case CALL_ATTRIBUTES:                     span.setTag("grpc.call_attributes", call.getAttributes().toString());                     break;                 case HEADERS:                     span.setTag("grpc.headers", headers.toString());                     break;             }         }          Context ctxWithSpan = Context.current().withValue(OpenTracingContextKey.getKey(), span);         ServerCall.Listener listenerWithContext = Contexts.interceptCall(ctxWithSpan, call, headers, next);         logger.debug("span :{}", span);         span.finish();         return new ForwardingServerCallListener.SimpleForwardingServerCallListener(listenerWithContext) {              @Override             public void onMessage(ReqT message) {                 delegate().onMessage(message); column3: New plugin loader core/mechanism for 3.3
column4: @OpenSkywalking/pmc @OpenSkywalking/committer-team   I spent several weeks to think and design, for making skywalking plugin mechanism more elegant than before, and providing following features. And this is the new feature for 3.3-preview. So we have enough time to discuss and review.  * New agent package folder. ``` +-- skywalking-agent     +-- activations          apm-toolkit-log4j-1.x-activation.jar          apm-toolkit-log4j-2.x-activation.jar          apm-toolkit-logback-1.x-activation.jar          ...     +-- config          agent.config       +-- plugins          apm-dubbo-plugin.jar          apm-feign-default-http-9.x.jar          apm-httpClient-4.x-plugin.jar          .....     skywalking-agent.jar ``` * All plugin jars can be added or removed from the default folder. Easier to add and remove plugins. Especially for private plugins, or some plugins have compatible issues. * Don't need to set `applicationCode` or `servers` from system.properties. All default configs have already been included in `/config/agent.config` file * Can override all config by system.properties and system.env. The keys in these two ways, should start with `skywalking.` + keyInConfigFile.  Such as:  Env key of `agent.application_code` shoule be `skywalking.agent.application_code` The priority flow is `env` > `properties` > `agent.config file` . @hanahmily this is you want, right? * Output logs into `/logs` folders as default. Still output `system.out` when log config is not ready, just a few lines logs.(Not finish yet) * Remove plugins enable/disable mechanism.(Not finish yet)  I will finish the last two in following days. The core has been finished, so pull request is created. And I think you guys are interesting in this feature too. @clevertension @hanahmily @IluckySi

column3: druid + mysql：compatibility problem?
column4: ### What version of sky-walking are you using? (the latest version of sky-walkiing) + druid-1.0.17.jar + mysql-connector-java-5.1.13.jar ----------------------------------------------------  When druid database source init, he will validate every connection he create. He invoke method  **pingInternal** in **com.mysql.jdbc.MySQLConnection** as default.But using sky-walking,the connection is proxy by **org.skywalking.apm.plugin.jdbc.SWConnection**,then druid execute the below code has different result. // clazz == com.mysql.jdbc.MySQLConnection // conn == org.skywalking.apm.plugin.jdbc.SWConnection      clazz.isAssignableFrom(conn.getClass()) >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 也就是说druid框架在检测数据库连接时想用到MySQLConnection的特有方法，导致程序有点不兼容，不使用ping方法检查连接。刚才druid-1.0.17的检测sql为空报错，之后的版本都有默认的sql。 我想问一下，有没有什么办法从sky-walking框架层次来解决这个问题，尽可能兼容已有的应用，同时不想增加对mysql-connector-java包的依赖。目前SWConnection只是java.sql.Connection的子类，没想到特别好的方法。  其他解决方法：其实可以升级druid框架或者增加检测sql="select 1"解决问题。  >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>            ` if (usePingMethod) {             if (conn instanceof DruidPooledConnection) {                 conn = ((DruidPooledConnection) conn).getConnection();             }             if (conn instanceof ConnectionProxy) {                 conn = ((ConnectionProxy) conn).getRawObject();             }             if (clazz.isAssignableFrom(conn.getClass())) {                 if (validationQueryTimeout < 0) {                     validationQueryTimeout = DEFAULT_VALIDATION_QUERY_TIMEOUT;                 }                 try {                     ping.invoke(conn, true, validationQueryTimeout);                     return true;                 } catch (InvocationTargetException e) {                     Throwable cause = e.getCause();                     if (cause instanceof SQLException) {                         return false;                     }                     LOG.warn("Unexpected error in ping", e);                     return false;                 } catch (Exception e) {                     LOG.warn("Unexpected error in ping", e);                     return false;                 }             }         }`

column3: the logs folder was created in the wrong location
column4: ### skywalking collector v3.0  my skywalking-collector was installed the path :  /estrace/skywalking/skywalking-collector when I started collector at directory 'bin' ,  ./startup.sh the Logs folder was created right location, at the bin same level, two logs files was created  collector.log skywalking-server-log4j2.log  but when I started collector at other directory  example :  ./bin/startup.sh two logs folders was be created , path :  /estrace/skywalking/skywalking-collector/logs and /estrace/skywalking/logs  The reason of the error: log4j2.xml ``` ../logs ``` The "log-path" is not relative log4j2.xml, but relative the start direcotry.  ## ## 中文解释 如果我在 bin 目录下通过 ./startup.sh 启动 collector 服务，则在bin 同级目录下创建一个logs文件夹，里面包含了  collector.log skywalking-server-log4j2.log 两个日志文件， 如果我不在 bin 目录下启动，例如， 在bin 同级目录下通过 ./bin/startup.sh 启动collector 服务，则在bin同级目录下创建一个logs文件夹，里面仅仅包含了 collector.log 同时在bin的上一级目录下也创建了一个 logs文件夹，包含了日志文件： skywalking-server-log4j2.log  这应该是一种错误配置导致的 在log4j2.xml配置文件中 ``` ../logs ``` ，为什么得到的结果是相对于当前启动的位置创建的目录，而不是相对于log4j2.xml的位置创建目录！
